1.content:
I rode my bike through the parking lot of my apartment complex, swerving to avoid the occasional pothole. Arriving outside my building, I locked up my bike and went inside. After checking the mail, I took the elevator up to the 3rd floor; hoping I didn’t get stuck in the elevator again. This building sucks.

The condition of the building was to be expected; after all, it was public housing. You see; my mom had me just after high school. It put a stop to her dream of going to college to be a TV reporter; instead, she had to work two jobs just to make ends meet.

Once the elevator finally arrived on my floor, I walked down the hall to the apartment. Letting myself in, I placed my backpack on the floor and closed the door. “Mom! I’m home!”

When I didn’t receive a response, I was about to look around when I saw a note on the kitchen counter.

Travis,
I got called into work tonight. I spoke with Aaron’s mother; you can spend the night there.
Mom

Aaron Sullivan had been my best friend since we were 5 years old. I spent so much time at his house, I considered it my second home. As I walked down the hall to my room, I thought that it would be nice to see Aaron again; his family had just gotten back from a trip to the Bahamas.

************************


It was a 15-minute ride from the apartment to Aaron’s house; I arrived there just as it was starting to get dark. Walking up to the front door, carrying my backpack with a change of clothes, I knocked on the door.

It didn’t take long for Aaron’s Mom to answer the door. “Hello, Travis.” Opening the door, she said, “Come on in.”

“Thanks, Mrs. S.” walking in, I placed my backpack on the floor next to their suitcases. “I’m sorry to barge in like this, but my mom had to work tonight.”

After closing the door behind me, Mrs. Sullivan looked at me and said, “Can I talk to you for a moment, Travis?”

“Sure.” Following Mrs. Sullivan into the kitchen, I said, “What’s wrong?”

“There’s nothing wrong, Travis.” Gesturing to a seat, she sat down and said, “I just wanted to ask how things were going at home.”

“We’re doing fine.” Sitting down, I looked at her and said, “I mean the diner cut back some of my mom’s house, but she’s picking up more hours at Hooters.”

“You know you can always come to Mr. Sullivan or me for help; we’re always willing to help you.”

Mrs. Sullivan was always looking out for me, even though I wasn’t her son. About a year earlier, when my Mom was going rough a financial rough patch, Mrs. Sullivan offered to adopt me in order to make things easier for her. My mom refused the offer; saying she’d always make sure I was okay.

“I know that Mrs. S.” pausing, I said, “I appreciate the offer, but we really are doing fine.”

Just then Mr. Sullivan came walking into the room. Seeing me, he said, “Hello Aaron, I heard you were going to be spending the night with us.”

Smiling, I said, “Hi Mr. Sullivan.”

“We were just getting ready to get some take out since I’m afraid we don’t have a lot of food here.” Grabbing his coat, Mr. Sullivan said, “I hope you’re in the mood for some pizza.”

“That sounds great!”
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
I walked upstairs shortly after Aaron’s parents went to get dinner. Heading down the hall, I saw Aaron’s little sister, Madison walking out of her room. “Hi, Madison.” Smiling, I said, “How are you doing?”

“Hi Travis!” running over to hug me, Madison said, “You want to see what I found in the Bahamas?”

“Sure.” Not wanting to disappoint her, I followed Madison into her room. “What did you find?”

Madison ran over to her bed and brought back what looked like an ordinary rock. Showing it to me, she said, “It’s a wishing stone.”

I decided to play along because I knew Madison would be upset if I didn’t. “How does it work?”

“You just hold it close to your mouth and whisper into it.” After whispering to the rock, she opened her window and threw it outside. “Once you’re done, you just throw it away.”

“What did you wish for?”

“Nuh-uh; you know the rule.” giggling, Madison said, “If I told you, then it wouldn’t come true.” If you tell your wish before you get it, it won't come true."

“Well, I hope it comes true for you.” Tousling Madison’s hair, I said, “I’m going to hang out with your brother now, I’ll see you later.”

“Bye!”

Walking down the hall to Aaron’s room, I went in to find him playing video games with his headphones on. Sneaking up behind him, I tapped him on the shoulder just enough to distract him. Not even a second later, the screen turned red – confirming that another player had just killed him.

“What the hell, man!” Turning around, taking the headphones off, Aaron said, “I was just about to kill that guy!”

“Yeah right.” Chuckling, I said, “You were always terrible at sniping people.”

Putting the controller down, Aaron said, “My folks said you’d be spending the night.” Looking at me, he said, “Your mom working again?”

“Yeah, she got called into work at the last minute apparently.”

************************


15 minutes later, Aaron and I were playing a multiplayer level on Call of Duty when I had the sudden urge to use the bathroom. The timing couldn’t have been better since I’d just been killed by a grenade. “I’ll be right back; I’m just going to use the bathroom.”

“Hurry back; I’m outnumbered here.”

Walking out of Aaron’s room, I started to make my way down the hall to the bathroom; only to stop outside Madison’s room. I didn’t know why, but I had the urge to go into her room. Unable to shake the urge, I opened her door and walked into find her having a tea party with some of her dolls.

Walking over to her, I sat down and said, “Mind if I join you?”

“Sure!” handing me a teacup, pretending to pour something into it, Madison said, “Have some tea.”

Taking a pretend sip, I said, “That’s very good tea, Madison.”

Madison and I continued doing that for about five minutes until Aaron came into the room. “I’ve been looking all over for you.” Looking at me, he said, “What are you doing here?”

“We’re having a tea party!” I was surprised to hear my voice was higher than normal and sounded like Madison whenever she was excited.

Aaron was surprised as well. “What’s wrong with your voice?”

Clearing my throat, I said, “Sorry, I-I don’t know what that was about.” Pausing, I said, “Madison and I were just having a tea party.”

Suddenly Aaron had a shocked look on his face. Looking at me, he said, “Travis, what’s happening to your face?”

“What do you mean?” seeing the same shocked look on Madison’s face, I said, “Why are you both looking at me like that?”

“You better look at yourself in the mirror.”

Standing up, I walked over to the mirror Madison used when she was playing dress-up. Looking at my reflection, I was shocked to say the least by what I saw. My face was no longer that of a teenage boy, it was closer to that of a little girl’s. I watched in silence as my hair started to get longer.

Overcome with shock, I fainted and fell to the floor.
11.title: An Innocent Wish

111.content:
When I regained consciousness, I saw Aaron and Madison standing over me; with concern written on both their faces. Looking at them, I said, “I dreamed...”

“This isn’t a dream, man.”

Hearing the sound of my voice, which sounded like a little girl's voice, I realized Aaron was right. Bringing my hands towards my face, I found long brown hair. “What happened to me?”

“We don’t know.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “Before you try and sit up...”

Aaron was too late, I was already sitting up before he could finish his sentence. Looking down, I found myself dressed up as a Disney Princess; Belle to be specific. I turned to Madison and noticed she was dressed as Cinderella. “What’s the deal? Why did you dress me like this?”

Shaking her head, Madison said, “We didn’t.”

“All this happened after you fainted; first your clothes changed and then Madison’s did.” Looking at me, he said, “Soon after, you...well I think you’d better see for yourself.”

It was when Aaron helped me to my feet that I realized he now towered over me; even though we’d been the same height.
Looking at my reflection in the mirror, I had to clap a hand over my mouth to keep from screaming.

I had been 10 years older than Madison, but now it looked like we were practically the same age. “How could this happen?”

Aaron opened his mouth to speak, but Madison beat him to it. “It worked.”

Before I could ask her what she meant, we heard a door closing in the distance; followed by Mr. Sullivan calling out, “Kids! The pizza’s here!”
111.title: Waking Up

1111.content:
All three of us went pale when we heard Mr. Sullivan’s voice. How would we possibly explain this to Aaron’s parents? Looking at Aaron, I said, “What are we going to do?”

“I don’t know.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “Perhaps we should just tell them what happened.”

“We don’t even know what happened!” panicking, I said, “They’ll never believe a 15-year-old boy somehow turned into a 5-year-old girl.”

“Well, we have to figure out something.” Pausing, Aaron said, “They’re probably going to start wondering why we haven’t come downstairs yet.”

Before any of us could do anything, the bedroom door opened and Mrs. Sullivan walked into the room. “There you are.” Looking at Madison and me, she said, “Girls, why don’t you change out of those dresses for dinner.”
1111.title: More Surprises

11111.content:
I couldn't believe it; Mrs. Sullivan wasn't the least bit surprised that I was now a girl Madison's age. In fact, it was as though she’d expected to see two girls in Madison’s room. I was about to ask her about it, but she started walking towards the door.
“Come on, Aaron.” Pausing, said, “Let’s give Lizzie and Madison some privacy so they can change.”

Once Mrs. Sullivan had closed the door, I walked over to where Madison was standing by the bed. “She called me Lizzie.”
Looking at her, I said, “It’s almost like she doesn’t remember me being a boy.”

Looking at me, as she took off her princess dress, Madison said, “I didn’t think it would work.”

As I took off my dress, I looked at Madison and said, “You didn’t think what would work?”

“The wishing stone.” Looking at me, Madison said, “I made a wish that you were my friend instead of Aaron’s, and now you are.”

Before all this, I would’ve found the idea of a magic rock granting wishes hard to believe. But as I looked at myself in the mirror, seeing the body of a 5-year-old girl looking back at me, I couldn’t argue with the facts.

I found some discarded clothes that Lizzie must’ve worn here; a pair of overalls and an orange shirt. After putting them on, I noticed a Disney overnight bag in the corner; which I figured was mine. Looking through it, I spotted a Frozen nightgown and a package that I couldn’t quite figure out what it was.

Once we were both dressed, Madison and I walked downstairs for dinner.
11111.title: The Surprises Continue

111111.content:
After dinner, Madison’s parents let us watch Despicable Me 3. It was around 7:45 when Mrs. Sullivan walked into the den and turned off the TV. Madison and I both groaned in annoyance. “Sorry girls, but it’s time for you to go bed.”

“But Mommy, we’re not tired!” looking at me, Madison said, “Can’t we just finish the movie?”

“I’m sorry sweetie, but you know the rules.” Looking at us, she said, “Make sure you both brush your teeth.”

With no other option, Madison and I obediently walked upstairs to the bathroom. After brushing our teeth, we walked by Aaron’s room. As Madison continued on, I poked my head inside to find Aaron watching a movie. Seeing me in the doorway, he paused the movie and said, “What’s up?”

“Your mom said it’s time for Madison and me to go bed.” Pouting, I said, “It’s not even 8:00 and I’m not even tired.”

“Don’t know what to tell you.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “As far as everyone else knows, you’re a 5 year old girl. I guess that means you have an early bedtime.”

“I guess so.” Sighing, I said, “I’ll see you in the morning.”

I walked down the hall to Madison’s room; entering just as she was getting changed into her nightgown. Looking at me, Madison said, “Come on, Lizzie; my mommy said she’d be up to tuck us in.”

I’d just finished getting changed into my nightgown when Mrs. Sullivan poked her head into the room. As Madison climbed into bed, she looked at me and said, “Lizzie, sweetie, can I talk to you for a moment?”

“Okay.”

I followed Mrs. Sullivan down the hall to the bathroom. Closing the door, she knelt down to my height. “Did you remember to wear your Pull-Ups?”
111111.title: Bedtime

1111111.content:
I was momentarily confused; until I saw the package from my bag sitting on the counter. Looking closer, I saw that it was an open package of Pull-Ups. As if being a 5-year-old girl wasn’t bad enough, I was not going to wear Pull-Ups to bed. “Do I have to wear those?”

Mrs. Sullivan must’ve thought I was being stubborn instead of embarrassed. Taking one out of the package, she looked at me and said, “I know you’re embarrassed to wear these, but your mom insisted.” Lifting up my nightgown, she said, “This is for your own good, sweetie.”

I could only stand there, in silence, as Mrs. Sullivan got me into the Pull-Ups. I was embarrassed enough by the notion that I was a bed wetter now, but I could’ve done without Aaron walking into the bathroom just as Mrs. Sullivan was pulling down my nightgown. “Sorry, I didn’t think anyone was in here.”

I hoped that Aaron hadn’t gotten a glimpse of the pull-ups I was wearing. “We’re all set here, sweetheart.” Looking at me, Mrs. Sullivan said, “Let me throw out this packaging and then I’ll be up to tuck you girls in.”

After Mrs. Sullivan left, Aaron looked at me and said, “Pull-ups, huh?” grinning, he said, “Are you a bed wetter now?”

“Shut up!” I glared at him and said, “It’s bad enough I have to wear these; I don’t need you rubbing it in.”

Without giving Aaron a chance to respond, I left the bathroom and walked back down the hall to Madison’s room. As I climbed into bed next to her, she said, “What did my mom want?”

“I’d rather not talk about it.”

It wasn’t long before Mrs. Sullivan walked into the room. After making sure we were snug underneath the sheets, she kissed us both on the forehead. “Goodnight girls.”
1111111.title: Pull-Ups

11111111.content:
I woke up just before 8:00 the next morning; hoping the previous night had just been a crazy dream. But that wasn’t the case – as I soon discovered when I saw Madison asleep next to me. Sitting up in the bed, I felt the Pull-Ups rubbing against my skin.

Hopping out of bed, I pulled up the nightgown to examine them and found a telltale yellow stain on the inside. Great, I really am a bed-wetter now.

Just then Madison woke up. Rubbing her eyes, she looked at me and said, “Good morning.”

Letting my annoyance seep through, I said, “What’s so good about it?”

Sittin up, she looked at me and said, What's wrong?"

Showing her my soiled pull-ups, I said, “I wet myself during the night; all because of your stupid wish!”

“How is that my fault?”

Looking at her, as my annoyance turned to anger, I said, “Who else wished me into a little girl!?”

Before Madison could respond, there was a knock on the door. Poking his head inside, Aaron said, “What’s with all the noise in here?”

“Your stupid little sister made a wish that turned me into a little girl!” yelling, I said, “That’s what!”

Looking at me, Madison yelled, “I’m not stupid!”

If Aaron was at all surprised to learn his sister was responsible for what happened to me, he didn’t show it. “Look, why don’t
both you of just calm down.” Turning to me, he said, “Liz...Travis, whatever your name is now, go get cleaned up and come down for breakfast.”

Madison and I both ran towards the bathroom; but I just barely beat her. That little triumph was enough to make me feel better about having to clean myself up because I wet the bed.
11111111.title: The Next Morning

111111111.content:
After getting dressed in another outfit I'd found in the overnight bag, I walked downstairs to find Madison and Aaron sitting at the kitchen table.

As I sat down, I noticed there was a distinct lack of food in the table. Looking at Aaron, I said, "What gives? I thought you said breakfast was ready?"

"Breakfast will be ready in a few minutes." Sighing, Aaron said, "In the mean time, I think you two need to talk."

"I have nothing to say to her." Glaring at her, I said, "Its because of her stupid wish that I'm a 5 year old girl now."

"I didn't think it would come true." Looking at me, Madison said, "I just wanted you to be my friend."

"I am your friend, Maddy." Sighing, I said, "I care about you very much."

"You don't really show it." Pouting, Madison said, "You always want to spend more time with Aaron then you do with me."

"That's because he was the same age as me." Pausing, I said, "He and I have more in common."

"Now that we're the same age, you have more in common with me."

"Okay, I think we're getting off track here." Looking at us, Aaron said, "You've both done stuff in the last 12 hours that you need to apologize for."

"What for?"

"Because, Travis, you're going to need Maddy's help learning how to behave like a 5 year old girl." Sighing, Aaron said, "That can't happen if until you both apologize."

I realized Aaron was right; if I wanted Madison's help, I'd need to apologize for what I did. Getting off the chair, I walked over to her and said, "I'm sorry I called you stupid."

Hopping off the chair, Madison looked at me and said, "I'm sorry that I turned you into a little girl."

After Madison and I hugged each other for a moment, Aaron said, "Now that we've settled that, I'll serve you guys breakfast." Standing up, Aaron said, "How do waffles sound?"

Both Madison and I got huge grins on our faces. As Aaron served the waffles, I wondered if he was prepared to deal with two 5 year olds hopped up on sugar.
111111111.title: Talking over Breakfast

1111111111.content:
The answer was no. Aaron wasn't the least bit ready to handle two 5-year-olds whose blood was now 50% maple syrup. "I think I liked it better when you were fighting," he said.

We didn't care. We took turns pulling his limbs and climbing on him. "Come play with us!" we begged.

"I can't," he replied. "I need to research that wishing stone. Go watch TV."

That sounded like a good idea, so we ran into the living room and turned on the TV. The Sullivans had been watching local TV last night, so the TV was tuned to that station. "Hey, look," I said, "my mom's on!"

She was standing in front of the apartment building where we lived. Apparently, something bad had happened there, but I wasn't paying attention. There was something wrong.

Her voice was different. Her eyes were different. What's more, she was called Melanie Richardson, not Melanie Rogers. "Is... Is she still my mommy?"

Aaron came in. "What's wrong?"

I pointed at the screen, where the woman I had known as my mother signed off, identifying herself again as Melanie Richardson. "What if she's not my mommy anymore?"

"Hey, I'm sure it'll be alright," Aaron said. "We'll see how things shake out when she comes to pick you up." He wiped the tears out of my eyes. "Let's find you something else to watch."

Aaron changed the channel to something more kid-friendly. Before, I dismissed cartoons as kid stuff, but this cartoon held me enthralled.
1111111111.title: Sugar Rush and a Big Surprise

11111111111.content:
Madison and I watched cartoons for about an hour until her parents came home; having evidently gone grocery shopping. Seeing Madison and me in the living room, Mrs. Sullivan said, “Good morning, girls.” Pausing, she said, “I hope you didn’t give Aaron too much trouble.”

Both Madison and I gave each other mischevious looks; before turning back towards Mrs. Sullivan. “Nope, we’ve just been watching cartoons.”

“That’s good.” Looking at me, Mrs. Sullivan said, “Lizzie, sweetie, your mom called; she’s going to be here in about 15 minutes.”

Not wanting to show my concern, I said, “Okay.”

Just then, Mr. Sullivan came in with a few more bags of groceries. Turning to her husband, as they both walked down the hall to the kitchen, Mrs. Sullivan said, “When Lizzie’s mom gets here; don’t bring up what we were talking about in the car. They haven’t told her yet.”

As they were going out of earshot, Mr. Sullivan said, “How many times do I have to say I won’t mention it?”

I started to wonder what they were referring to; was it something important? Before I could say anything, Madison said, “Lizzie, the shows back on!”

Until this happened, I never thought I’d be watching Thomas & Friends again; having watched it the first time I’d been 5 years old. But now I was excited to watch it again. Giggling, I said, “Yay!”

**********************


Sure enough, 15 minutes later, I heard a car horn outside. Mr. and Mrs. Sullivan were in the kitchen putting away the groceries; while Aaron was outside mowing the lawn. Looking at me, Madison saw my worried look and said, “It’s going to be fine.”

Before I could say anything, Aaron walked in through the front door. Turning to me, he said, “Lizzie, I think your mom’s here.”

I stood up and slowly walked towards the door; worried that the woman I was about to see wasn’t the same one I’d seen yesterday morning. My worries vanished when I stopped in the doorway. Walking up the sidewalk was my Mom. Sure she looked different than when I’d seen her last; before all this, my mom’s idea of a casual ‘out of work’ outfit was a t-shirt and jeans.
While she wasn’t wearing the same outfit she’d worn on the TV, she still looked professional.

Once she got close enough, she smiled and said, “Hi sweetie.”

I was suddenly overcome with joy. With a smile on my face, I ran out the door yelling, “Mommy! Mommy! Mommy!”
11111111111.title: Mom Picks Me Up

111111111111.content:
Mom knelt down as I ran up to her, scooping me up in her arms and hugging me. Kissing me on the forehead, she said, "Hi sweetie, did you have fun at Madison's?"

Until now I hadn't gotten a good look at what mom looked like now. I could still tell it was her, but there were differences to be sure.

For starters, her eyes weren't dilated like they'd been when I saw her yesterday morning and she didn't smell like booze. She'd always focused on taking care of me more than she did herself; in the last few years she'd been drinking and abusing cold medicine.

I was glad to see this was no longer appeared to be the case - the only time I'd ever seen her like this was in a photo taken with some girlfriends a few months before I was conceived.

Snapping back to reality, I put a smile on my face and said, "Uh huh! We played dress up!"

Before she could respond, Aaron walked up to us. "Hi Mrs. Richardson."

"Aaron, please call me Aunt Mel." With a smile on her face, Mom said, "Now come here and give me a hug."

Aaron quickly leaned in and gave my mom a hug. As he pulled back, I could see he was embarrassed about something. I didn't know what it was until I saw him subtly adjust his pants. I let out a little giggle, which got me a quick glare from Aaron while my mom wasn't looking.

Mom walked me back to the car, which looked to be a new SUV instead of the old clunker she used to drive. As she opened the back door, I frowned when I saw a booster seat on the rear seat.

I went silent as Mom placed me in the booster seat. After making sure I was snug, she went back towards the house. Once she was out of earshot, I started to squirm a little in the booster seat.

Seeing Aaron walking towards me, I said, "This is so embarrassing." Sighing, I said, "I was getting ready to take my learner's permit test, now I'm forced to sit in this booster seat."

"That's what happens when you're a little kid." Looking at me, Aaron said, "Madison doesn't have a problem sitting in them. I'm sure if you give it time, you'll get used to it."

"I don't want to get used to it." Pouting, I said, "I want to be a big boy again."

Seeing the expression on my face, Aaron started to chuckle. When I started to glare at him, he said, "You look adorable when you're angry."

"You wouldn't think this was so adorable if you were in my position."

Just then Mom came back to the car with my overnight bag. Seeing the annoyed look on my face, she said, "Is someone getting a little cranky?"

Wanting to have a little fun at my expense, Aaron said, "She and Madison both had 5 waffles for breakfast; I think she's coming down from her sugar rush."

"Well then, it's a good thing daddy doesn't land for a few hours." Placing the bag next to me, Mom said, "That's just enough time for you to have a nap, young lady."

"But I'm not tired!"

Moving to close the door, Mom said, "Say goodbye, sweetie."

As much as I hated to admit it, I was starting to get tired and a little cranky. Without looking at Aaron, I simply said, "Bye."

After saying goodbye to Aaron, mom got into the car and we drove off. I waved to Madison as we drove by.

As we left the neighborhood, I was worried about what was coming next - I was going home to a family that only remembered me as a little 5 year old girl.
111111111111.title: Going Home

1111111111111.content:
Despite my protests to the contrary, I did end up taking a nap almost immediately after coming home. I woke up about 3 hours later, just after 2:45. Sitting up in the bed, I got my first decent look at my new room – and there was no doubt it was a room for a 5-year-old girl.

Almost everything was in varying shades of pink. It looked a lot like Madison’s room; there was a dollhouse along with a table and chairs for tea parties. I even saw a chest sitting on the floor, next to a mirror, that I could only assume had dress-up costumes inside it. This certainly beats my old room; even if it’s for a little girl.

Getting out of bed, I walked over to a window and looked outside; surprised to find a spacious backyard with a playhouse and swing set in one corner. A big smile appeared on my face when I saw an above ground pool attached to the deck. I guess if I’m stuck like this for a while, there are worse places to live.

Heading towards the bedroom door, I walked out into the hall. I slowly made my way towards the stairs, not really having any idea where I was going. Walking downstairs, I found myself standing outside a large family room; half of which was taken up what I could only assume was a play area for me. Wow, this place is awesome!

Walking through the family room, passing the large TV on the wall, I spotted some photos out of the corner of my eye. Most of them were of me at various ages, but there was one in particular that caught my eye. It was a picture of my mom and a man standing in front of a tree. My mom was wearing a wedding dress, so I could only assume the photo was on their wedding day. Looking at the photo, I saw how happy mom looked; a far cry from the woman I’d known until yesterday.

Hearing a noise nearby, I walked back into the hall and found myself in the kitchen. I saw mom sitting at the kitchen table, looking through some mail. My heart dropped sank when I saw a pill bottle sitting next to her. The mom I knew used to take pills regularly; I hoped that wasn’t the case here. “Mommy, are you alright?”

“Sweetie, you startled me.” Turning to face me, Mom said, “Mommy’s fine, I just have a little headache.”

“When’s daddy coming home?”

“His plane lands in an hour, so we’ll probably be leaving soon.” Picking me up, Mom said, “Why don’t you watch some cartoons until we leave.”

As mom carried me back into the family room, I once again spotted the wedding photo. I would have preferred not to ask it in such a childish way, but my curiosity got the better of me. “Mommy, how did you and Daddy meet?”

“Daddy and I met in college; your Aunt Megan, Daddy’s sister, was my roommate.” Sitting down on the couch, with me in her lap,
Mom said, “The three of us spent a lot of time together, much like you and Madison. One day he stopped by our room and, instead of asking to see her, he asked if I wanted to go to the movies.”

As I listened, I hoped I was doing a good job of hiding my emotions; because I was feeling sad on the inside. Mom always told me she never regretted having me; but after hearing this, I felt somewhat responsible for keeping her from having the life she deserved.
1111111111111.title: A Few Hours Later

11111111111111.content:
Mommy and I got to the airport about 20 minutes before daddy’s flight was supposed to land. On the drive here, I learned that he’d gone to a friend’s bachelor party. After finding a parking spot, with me in her arms, Mommy and I went into the airport to wait.

I watched as other people came and went; waiting patiently for daddy to come down the escalator. As I stood next to mommy, I started to worry as to why I’d subconsciously started referring to them as mommy and daddy instead of mom and dad. The best explanation I could come up with was that Madison’s personality had rubbed off on me. At least I hoped that was the case.

I was starting to get antsy when Mommy squeezed my hand and said, “Here comes Daddy, sweetie.”

Looking up, I saw her pointing towards the escalator. It took me a moment, but I finally spotted the man from the photo – the man who was now my dad. Before I realized what I was doing, much like when I’d seen Mommy at Madison’s, I started running towards him yelling, “Daddy! Daddy!”

Daddy knelt down as I got closer and scooped me up in his arms; giving me a kiss on the forehead as he did so. “There’s my little princess.”

I giggled a little bit when I heard that. Giving him a peck on the cheek, I said, “I missed you, daddy.”

Walking towards mommy, he said, “I missed you too, pumpkin.”

I watched as Mommy and Daddy kissed each other; surprised to find the whole display a little disturbing. “Ewww!”

*************************


After Daddy got his luggage from the baggage claim, the three of us walked back to where the car was parked. Once I was buckled into my booster seat, and they got into the car, Mommy started driving towards the exit.

On the way, she turned to Daddy and said, “What do you say we treat Lizzie to a little family fun?”

“I think that would be a great idea.” Looking at me, Daddy said, “Pumpkin, what do you say we take you to Chuck E Cheese?”

A small part of me, the part that was still a 15-year-old boy, got the feeling that they were up to something. But the part of me that was a 5-year-old girl didn’t care about that. My excitement about going to Chuck E Cheese was greater than my concern that they were up to something. “YAY!!”
11111111111111.title: The Airport

111111111111111.content:
Chuck E Cheese was followed by a trip to Dairy Queen for ice cream. I sat in my booster seat, eating my ice cream, as Mommy drove home.

The whole drive home, I found myself thinking that something was definitely up – why else would Mommy and Daddy take me to Chuck E Cheese and ice cream. A growing part of me, however, didn’t care; I was having fun. Why did my brain insist on cluttering that up with suspicion?

Once we got back to the house, which I realized was in a neighborhood not far from Aaron’s house, Daddy carried me inside while Mommy closed the door. Looking at Mommy, Daddy said, “Is there anything else, before I put our tired little princess to bed?”

“I can think of one thing.”

Something is definitely going on here.

“That’s right, I almost forgot.” Nodding, Daddy said, “It’s not something we can hide for very much longer.”

As Daddy carried me upstairs, Mommy said, “Who’s going to do the honors?”

“I think it’s only appropriate that you do the honors, babe.”

Once we were in my room, Mommy took me and sat me down on her lap. “Lizzie, sweetie, we’ve got some big news.” Looking at me, she said, “We think its time we told you what it was.”

“What kind of news?”

“You're going to be a big sister."

Mommy was pregnant.

Normally that was happy news, and I would have shared in the happiness. But these weren’t normal circumstances – I didn’t want to be a big sister. As if the stress from the last day hadn’t been enough, this news was enough to push me over the edge – I began to cry.

Mommy pulled a tissue out of her purse and started to wipe away my tears. Looking at me, she said, “Well, say something, sweetie.”

I did, but it definetly wasn’t what Mommy and Daddy expected. Looking at them, I said, “I don’t wanna be a big sister! I don't wanna! I don't wanna! I don't wanna!"

Mommy held me close to her shoulder as I cried. Looking at Daddy, she said, “I guess she’s not quite ready yet.”

But that wasn’t why I was crying; at least not entirely. I wanted to be a big brother, not a big sister. Or maybe I still wanted Mommy and Daddy to myself. But mostly it was the idea that I was going to be a big sister...I think.
111111111111111.title: Some Shocking News

1111111111111111.content:
When I woke up the next morning, my thoughts immediately went to the news Mommy and Daddy told me last night. I instantly remembered not taking it very well. Sitting up in bed, I realized that I needed to apologize for how I’d acted. After all, Mommy was going to have this stupid baby whether I wanted her to or not. Wait, did I just call the baby stupid?

Pushing that thought aside, I climbed out of bed. Hearing noises coming from Mommy and Daddy’s room, I walked down the hall. Poking my head inside, I saw Daddy asleep in bed and a light on in the bathroom.

Quietly sneaking past daddy, I walked into the bathroom and saw Mommy getting ready for work.

I couldn't help but look at her and think about how pretty she looked in her dress.
I found myself wishing I looked that pretty when I grew up.

Mommy must’ve spotted me out of the corner of her eyes, because she put down her mascara and looked at me, “Sweetie, what are you doing up so early?”

I turned and saw a clock on a nearby table – it read 6:15. Looking back to Mommy, I said, “I’m sorry, Mommy.”

Kneeling down in front of me, Mommy said, “Sorry for what, sweetie?”

“I’m sorry about last night with the baby.”

“Sweetie, that’s alright; it’s normal for kids your age to react that way.” Looking at me, Mommy said, “Daddy and I should have told you more delicately.”

All my issues from last night started to come back; mainly how I didn’t want to share Mommy and Daddy. “But you’re my mommy and daddy.”

“Is that what this is all about?” picking me up, Mommy said, “Sweetie, just because you’re going to be a big sister doesn’t mean I won’t be your mommy anymore.”

A part of me knew that, but a larger part of me wasn’t sure. “Really?”

“Of course, sweetie.” Kissing me on the forehead, Mommy said, “You’re my baby girl; I’ll always love you no matter what.”

“Thanks, Mommy.”

Carrying me back to my room, Mommy tucked me back into bed. Kissing me again, she said, "Have fun with daddy today, sweetie."
1111111111111111.title: The Next Morning

11111111111111111.content:
It was 8:30 when I woke up again. As I sat up in bed, I heard some noises from downstairs.

Climbing out of bed, I walked downstairs to find daddy making breakfast. Going up to him, I hugged his leg and said, "Morning daddy."

"Morning kiddo." Tousling my hair, he said, "Did you sleep well?"

"Uh huh."

"Since it's just the two of us today, what do you say we have one of our daddy-daughter days?"

I didn't want to disappoint daddy, but I had no idea what to expect from a daddy-daughter day. In fact, until Madison's wish, I never really had a father figure in my life. Looking at daddy, I said, "Okay daddy!"

"Great." Picking me up, daddy carried me over to the table. Looking at me, he said, "Why don't we have breakfast then how about we have a beach day?"

Never one to pass up a chance to go to the beach, be it as a boy or a girl, I was excited by the idea. "Okay!!"
11111111111111111.title: Breakfast with Daddy

111111111111111111.content:
Once we got to the beach and parked the car, our first stop was the bathroom. “I don’t want you swimming on a full bladder.”
I wasn’t happy about the idea, but I went ahead and did my business anyway. Walking out of the stall, I saw my reflection in the mirror – that of a little girl wearing a Dora the Explorer one-piece bathing suit. I had to admit, as weird as this situation was, I did make an adorable little girl.

Walking out of the bathroom, I saw daddy blowing up a pair of inflatable water wings. Looking at me, he said, “You’re doing good in your swim lessons, but I just want to be on the safe side.”

I was a little annoyed at that revelation; while I hadn’t been a pro swimmer before the wish, I was pretty good at it. To find myself in a situation where I needed water wings was pretty embarrassing.

Daddy and I walked onto the beach; after putting the water wings on my arms, he spread out a blanket. Rather than go straight to the water, I turned my attention to a box of beach toys that Daddy had brought. Looking at them, I said, “Daddy, can we make a sandcastle?”

“Of course we can, sweetie.” Taking my hand, Daddy said, “But first, why don’t we go for a swim.”

As I followed daddy down to the water, I dipped a toe into it and pulled it back – the water was cold. Gesturing to the ocean, Daddy said, “Would you look at all that water, Lizzie?”

Looking out at the water, seeing a few boats go by, I said, “Wow!”

“And just think; that’s just the top of it!”

We both laughed at Daddy’s joke; after which we both went into the water. We didn’t go too deep, just far enough that I could just barely touch the bottom; but it didn’t matter to me, we were swimming. This is amazing, I’m swimming my daddy.

Mommy never really talked much about my daddy before Madison’s wish; at least not to me. I think there were times where she’d mention him to some of her boyfriends. Mommy had a lot of boyfriends before the wish. When I was little the first time, most of them would leave as soon as they saw me.]=

As I got older, some of them would stick around longer; but none came close to marrying her. There was one guy, that I remember, who told me, “Kid, I like your mom, but she's got more issues than National Geographic.”

I do remember one time, hearing her talk about someone who might have been my daddy. I was about 9 years old; it was morning and I wanted some breakfast. I’d stopped in the hall outside the kitchen as Mommy talked to her then-boyfriend. “Sometimes I wonder if things would’ve been different if I hadn’t had so much to drink; or if my gown hadn’t been so low-cut.”

“Why don’t you ever ask yourself what if he hadn’t done what he did?”

But that was before. Now I had a happy mommy and a daddy who loved us both.

****************************


We stayed in the water for another 15 minutes or so. After a while, we both started to get a little cold. As we stepped out of the water, Daddy looked at me and said, “What did the ocean say to the beach?”

Looking at Daddy, I said, "What?"

"Nothing.” Smiling, he said, “It just waved."

Daddy and I both laughed as we walked back to the towel. I began to think Daddy had a million of these jokes.
111111111111111111.title: Beach Day

1111111111111111111.content:
Daddy and I spent almost 2 hours at the beach; where we built a sandcastle and Daddy let me bury him in the sand. If anyone had been watching us, they would have seen a little girl having fun with her father.

After we left the beach, Daddy took us to Burger King for lunch; after making me promise not to tell Mommy. As we sat outside the play area, Daddy with his whopper and me with my Kid’s Meal, Daddy looked at me. “Mommy told me why you were so upset last night.”

“She did?”

“Uh-huh.” Putting his burger down, Daddy said, “Lizzie, sweetie, you have nothing to worry about. Just because you’ll have a little brother, or sister, doesn’t mean Mommy and I will love you any less.”

I wasn’t entirely convinced. “It doesn’t?”

“Of course not.” Getting up, Daddy knelt down in front of me and said, “You’re our little girl; no matter what happens, we’ll always love you.”

“You promise?”

“I can’t promise we’ll always have time to spend with you; after all, babies need a lot of attention.” Looking at me, Daddy said, “You need a lot of attention yourself when you were a baby.”

“Could I help you with the baby?”

“Of course you can.” Smiling, Daddy said, “You’re going to be a big sister; you can help however you want.”
1111111111111111111.title: Lunch

11111111111111111111.content:
After we got home, I helped Daddy carry some of the things inside. Once that was done, he looked at me and said, “Time for your nap, pumpkin.”

I wasn’t going to fight it like I’d done the day before; I did see the need for daily naps now. “Okay, Daddy.”

Going upstairs to my room, I closed the door and climbed into bed. As I rest my head on my pillow, I started thinking about how much my life had changed in such a short time. Two days ago I was a 15-year-old boy, living in a crummy apartment and worried about his mommy. Now I was a 5-year-old girl in a happy home.

I spent the next minute or so trying to get comfortable. As I did that, I brought my thumb up to my mouth. Without even thinking about it, I stuck it in my mouth and started sucking. It didn’t feel weird at all; it felt comforting...and familiar.

*****************************


It was the middle of the afternoon when I woke up from my nap. Climbing out of bed, I went downstairs to find Daddy. It didn’t take long to find him in the kitchen, doing something in the fridge.

He must’ve heard me coming because, without looking up, he said, “Did you have a good nap, Lizzie?”

“Uh-huh.” Walking up to the fridge, I said, “What are you doing?”

“I’m checking to make sure the steaks are thawing for dinner tonight.” Closing the fridge door, Daddy turned to me and said, “I thought we were done with that.”

I wondered what he was talking about; until I realized I was still sucking my thumb for my nap. I quickly pulled my thumb from my mouth and, with a childish grin, said, “Sorry daddy.”

“I see you’re falling back on some old habits.” Kneeling down, Daddy said, “This new baby must have you pretty nervous.”

You have no idea what has me nervous, Daddy.
11111111111111111111.title: Returning Home

111111111111111111111.content:
It was just before midnight when I was suddenly awakened by a loud noise outside. Sitting up in bed, holding Mr. Bunny, I wondered what the sound had been. It was then that I saw a flash of lightning outside my window; followed almost immediately by a loud clap of thunder.

My heart immediately started to race. Jumping out of bed, with Mr. Bunny in my arms, I ran down the hall to Mommy and Daddy’s room. Stopping on Mommy’s side of the bed, I started shaking her. “Wake up, mommy.”

After a few seconds, Mommy woke up and looked at me. “What’s wrong, sweetie? Did you have an accident?”

That reminded me that I was once again wearing a pair of pull-ups. Looking at Mommy, I said, “The thunder is scary.”

Daddy woke up at that moment and saw me standing at the foot of the bed. “What’s going on?”

“It seems that Lizzie is afraid of the storm outside.” Looking at Daddy, Mommy said, “I think she’d feel better if she slept in here with us.”

“I don’t see a problem with that.” Looking at me, Daddy said, “Don’t worry, pumpkin, we’ll keep you safe.”

As mommy lifted me onto the bed, I scrambled in between them. I wasn’t sure who I wanted to sleep closer to; but Mommy and Daddy quickly made that decision for me – as they both turned to face me and moved closer to the point where I was snug between them. Kissing me on the forehead, Mommy said, “Get some sleep, sweetie.”

“Okay, mommy.”

As I lay in my parent’s bed, with my eyes closed, I started to think – Why was I so afraid of thunder now?
111111111111111111111.title: During the Night

1111111111111111111111.content:
When I woke up the next morning, I immediately noticed two things: daddy wasn’t in bed and I was now lying in bed with my head on Mommy’s chest. As I woke up some more, I became aware of the fact that I was sucking my thumb again. What’s that about?

I took my thumb out of my mouth just as Mommy opened her eyes. Looking at me, she said, “Aren’t you the perfect thing to wake up to in the morning.”

I let out a giggle and kissed Mommy on the cheek. “Morning, Mommy.”

“Good morning, sweetie.” Kissing me, as she sat up, Mommy said, “Where is your father?”

As if on cue, Daddy walked in with a tray of food; what looked like eggs and sausage for Mommy and Daddy plus a bowl of cereal for me. “Glad to see you’re both awake.”

As Daddy sat down at the edge of the bed, Mommy said, “What’s all this for?”

“I was thinking since you don’t have to work today, that the three of us could stay in bed for a little while.” With a grin, Daddy looked at me and said, “Maybe watch some cartoons?”

I don’t know what I was more excited about; having breakfast in bed with my parents or watching cartoons. I quickly realized it didn’t matter; so long as I was with them. “Cartoons!”

Daddy climbed back into bed and served breakfast to Mommy and me. As he did that, Mommy said, “I can’t ask for a better start to my day.”
1111111111111111111111.title: The Next Morning

11111111111111111111111.content:
I’m sure Mommy and Daddy hadn’t planned on spending the entire morning in bed with me; but that’s what ended up happening. We had just finished watching Toy Story 3, when an idea popped into my head. Looking at Mommy, I said, “Mommy, I want pigtails like Jessie!”

“Okay sweetie.” Smiling, Mommy said, “If that’s what you want.”

**************************


It took about an hour for mommy to put my hair into the pigtails. After thanking her, I ran back to my room. Once inside, I started to rummage through my chest of costumes until I’d found what I was looking for – a sheriff’s costume.

As I stood in front of the mirror, putting the costume on, I came to a sudden realization. Until now, I’d had no idea that costume was in the chest – how could I have possibly known it was there.

Putting that thought out of my mind, I ran downstairs. I walked into the kitchen to find Mommy standing by the fridge. Seeing me, a smile on her face, she said, “Uh-oh, it’s the sheriff!”

“Daddy’s been a bad person.” Giggling, I said, “I need to awest him.”

“I think he’s in the garage, sheriff.” Chuckling, Mommy said, “But don’t be too hard on him.”

Walking down the hall, I found daddy standing by his workbench in the garage. Going up to him, I said, “You’re under arrest, Mister!”

Playing along, Daddy turned to me and said, “You’ll never catch me alive, Sheriff!!”

Before I knew what was going on, Daddy ran back into the house. Chasing after him, I caught him in the kitchen. “You’ve been bad!”

**************************


Daddy and I continued playing around for about an hour; until I heard the doorbell ring. Mommy went to answer the door; letting Aaron and Madison into the house. Looking at me, Mommy said, “Sorry kiddo, but Daddy and I have to go; we have plans with Madison’s parents.”

I remembered Mommy saying that she and daddy were going to see a movie with Madison’s parents. Walking over to Daddy, who was in a ‘jail’ I’d made out of couch cushions, I said, “You’re free to go, daddy.”

“Thank you, sheriff.” Kneeling down, Daddy kissed me on the forehead, “I promise I’ll be good from now on.”

Mommy gave me a kiss before walking out the door with Daddy. Before closing the door, she said, “Be a good girl for Aaron, sweetie.”

“Okay, mommy.”

Once the door closed, I turned to find Aaron and Madison looking at me; both of them with confused looks on their faces. Looking at me, Aaron said, “You mind telling us what that was all about?”
11111111111111111111111.title: Later that Day

111111111111111111111111.content:
As soon as Aaron said, it was like my mind had cleared. “I don’t know.” Looking at Aaron, I said, “The other day, after my mom picked up me from your house, I took a nap. When I woke up, I felt more like a little kid.”

“What exactly does that mean?”

Gesturing to my sheriff’s costume, I said, “For starters, I knew exactly where to find this in my room.” walking into the family room, I said, “Not only that, but I started thinking of my parents as Mommy and Daddy, I’ve started sucking my thumb, and now I’m afraid of thunderstorms.”

“How do you feel now?”

“I feel more like myself.” Sighing, I said, “But I felt like myself for the past two days.”

Walking over to me, Madison turned to Aaron and said, “What’s causing this?”

“I can’t be certain, but I think it has something to do with us.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “When you’re not around us, Travis goes away and Lizzie takes over.”

Looking at me, Madison said, “You said you’ve been sucking your thumb?”

“Apparently it’s a habit that I used to have.” Looking at my thumb, I said, “My folks think it's a reaction.”

“A reaction to what exactly?”

“My mom’s pregnant.”

In shock, Aaron looked at me and said, “A-Are you sure?”

“I’m sure.” Pausing, I said, “Otherwise that’s a pretty cruel joke to play on a 5 year old.”

“Oh wow.” Taking a breath, Aaron said, “How did you take the news?”

“Not all that well.” Sighing, I said, “I threw a temper tantrum after they told me.”

“Really?” shocked, Aaron said, “You threw a tantrum over that?”

“You would’ve done the same if you were in my shoes.” Looking at Aaron, I said, “At the time, I was scared of the idea that I wasn’t going to be the center of attention anymore.”

“I guess that’s pretty understandable.” Shrugging, Aaron said, “Most kids your age would probably react that way.”

“I’m not like other 5-year-olds, Aaron.” Looking at him, I said, “I’m only this way because of Madison’s wish.”

“Speaking of Madison’s wish, I’ve been doing some research over the last few days.”

“Have you made any progress?”

“Not really; most of the information I’ve been able to find has come from stories created by people online.” Looking at me, he said, “I’m sure there are some legitimate sources out there, I just have to find them.”

“So what do we do in the meantime?”

Gesturing to Madison, who was playing with some toys in the corner, Aaron said, “Why don’t you go play, I’ll do some more digging and see what I can find.”
111111111111111111111111.title: What's Happening?

1111111111111111111111111.content:
Madison and I spent the next hour playing some of my toys; all while Aaron sat on the couch with his laptop. Looking at me, Madison said, “For what it’s worth, you seemed to be having fun before we showed up.”

“I was having fun.” Leaning closer, I said, “Having never really had a loving family, I didn’t know what I was missing out on.”

“Maybe making that wish wasn’t such a bad thing after all.”

“I’d much rather be a guy right now, but there are worse things than being a 5-year-old girl.”

Just then, Aaron looked up from his laptop and said, “I think I found something.”

Madison and I walked over to the couch. Looking at Aaron, I said, “Really?”

“Yeah.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “There’s this psychic in town that might be able to help.”

“How is a psychic supposed to help?” looking at Aaron, I said, “Most of them are fake anyway.”

Turning the screen so I could see, Aaron said, “Just look at this.”

I had to stand up on my toes to see the screen, but I saw a website for a psychic named Madame Burke. Her page said she was not only a psychic but an expert on mystical objects. Looking up at Aaron, I said, “Are you really thinking we should go see her?”

“What do you have to lose?”

“Okay fine.” Sighing, I said, “Let me get changed and then we’ll go.”
1111111111111111111111111.title: Playtime

11111111111111111111111111.content:
I kind of felt bad for Aaron as he led Madison and me downtown. Almost as soon as we left the house, Madison and I got a sudden burst of energy. We alternated between skipping down the sidewalk and running. Aaron tried his best to keep us under control, but there wasn’t much he could do.

Until that is when Madison and I almost ran across a crosswalk into on-coming traffic. After he’d stopped us at the last minute, Aaron grabbed us both by the arm and dragged us down a nearby alley. “What the hell is wrong with you two; you almost ran into oncoming traffic.”

I was surprised to find myself somewhat frightened by Aaron’s tone; looking at Madison, I saw she was feeling the same way.
Looking at him, I said, “We’re sorry.”

“I can understand Madison acting this way.” Looking at me, Aaron said, “But I expected better from you.”

“I’m sorry, Aaron.” Looking at him, feeling about 5 inches tall, I said, “I-I just got carried away.”

“Just be more careful.”

After Aaron finished his lecture, the three of us safely crossed the street and walked down to where Madame Burke’s store was. As we walked into the store, I found that it was filled with all sorts of strange items. I was starting to remember why I thought psychics were frauds; especially once I spotted bottles of what was supposedly ‘love potions.’

“Can we get out of here; this place is giving me the creeps.” Turning to Aaron, I said. “Besides, how could she possibly help us?”

Before Aaron could respond, I heard footsteps from the back. I saw a middle-aged woman walk through a doorway. Looking at me, she said, “You, of all people, should be open to every possibility...Travis.”
11111111111111111111111111.title: Visiting the Psychic

111111111111111111111111111.content:
My eyes widened as soon as I heard that. Looking at her, I said, “H-How do you know my name?"

“I’m Madame Burke; it is my business to know that which others don’t.”

"I guess we came to the right person," Aaron said.

Clutching her robe, I said, “Please, I need your help.” Looking up at her, I said, “I don’t want her to take over again.”

Raising an eyebrow, Madame Burke said, “Her?”

“My friend’s sister, Madison, used a wishing stone; it turned me into a 5-year-old girl.” Pausing, I said, “Sometimes Lizzie likes to take over.”

Kneeling down to my level, Madame Burke placed a finger on my lips. “Exactly who do you think Lizzie is?”

“She’s the 5-year-old girl that I turned into.” Gesturing to Aaron and Madison, I said, “We seem to be the only ones who remember that I was a boy.”

“If that’s true, then why do you refer to Lizzie as someone else?”

“Because I’m a boy.”

“You just said you were a girl.” Sitting down, she said, “Travis, Lizzie; both are two sides of the same code. Lizzie can’t ‘take over’; because the two of you are the same person. Do you understand?"

"I... I think so."

“Madame Burke, we came here because we thought you could help us.” Taking the wishing stone out of his pocket, Aaron said, “What can you tell us about these wishing stones?”

“Wishing stones are ancient and powerful, but they can only be used once.” Taking the stone from Aaron, she said, “They can’t be used with the intent of enriching anyone.”

“That doesn’t make any sense.” Looking at Madame Burke, I said, “My mommy’s doing so much better with me as a little girl.”

“I can only assume that wasn’t Madison’s intention when she made her wish.”

“No, ma’am.” Shaking her head, Madison said, “I just wished that Travis could be my friend.”

“That’s exactly my point.” Looking at me, Madame Burke said, “By delaying your birth, your mother’s life is different from the one you knew before.”
111111111111111111111111111.title: A Shock

1111111111111111111111111111.content:
“Is there anything you can do to help us find another one of these stones?”

“I’m sorry, Travis, but I can’t.” looking at me, Madame Burke said, “Quite frankly, I didn’t believe they really existed until I met you.”

“So I’m stuck like this forever?”

“Would that truly be a bad thing?” kneeling down to my level, once again, Madame Burke said, “From what I can tell, your life now is much better than the one before. You have two loving parents, and you’re going to be a big sister.”

I almost asked how she knew about my mom’s pregnancy. “But I don’t know anything about being a girl.” Looking at her, I said, “The only time I seem to act like one is when I’m not around Aaron or Madison.”

“I suspect that will become more prominent as time goes by.” Pausing, Madame Burke said, “In time, Travis and Lizzie’s personalities will merge; until there’s no longer a way to tell them apart.”

“I don’t like that sound of that.” Looking at Madame Burke, Aaron said, “You may not be able to help us, but is there anyone you can think of that might?”

“I might know someone.” Standing up, Madame Burke said, “I’ll reach out to them and see what they know.”

“That’s good enough for me.” Grabbing a piece of paper, Aaron said, “Here’s my cell phone number.”

“I’ll be in touch.”

After leaving the shop, I turned to Aaron and said, “I really hope that wasn’t a big waste of time.”

“I’m sure she’ll be able to help us.”

I was about to say something when I heard a ringing noise coming from Aaron’s pocket. Looking at him, I said, “I think someone’s texting you.”

Reaching into his pocket, Aaron retrieved his phone. After a second, he said, “That’s weird, I just got a text from Becky Goodwin.”
Becky Goodwin was a classmate of Aaron’s and mine at school. The three of us were friendly, but never really hung out. Looking at Aaron, I said, “What does she want?”

“She just got back from vacation and wants to hang out.”

“I guess we know who you’re friends are in this reality.” Pausing, I said, “You should invite her over to my house.”

“You think your folks would be okay with that?”

“I don’t see why not.”

“Okay then, I’ll text her and tell her to come over.”
1111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Step

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
The whole way home, Aaron expressed his astonishment. "I can't believe I'm good friends with Becky Goodwin."

"Congratulations," I said. "I wouldn't mind seeing Becky again."

We turned on the TV and tuned in to Paw Patrol. "You like this show?" Aaron asked.

I shrugged. "Guess Madame Burke wasn't kidding."

Aaron made macaroni and cheese for lunch, which was guaranteed to please. As we ate, I thought about what Madame Burke had said about my life now. I had a happy mommy, a daddy who loved me, and a little brother or sister on the way. And all it cost me was that I was now a little girl. Was it as bad as I thought before?

The doorbell rang. Aaron looked at the clock. "That must be Becky."

He went to the door and opened it. "Hey, Bec - "

That was as far as he got. As soon as she came in, Becky wrapped her arms around Aaron and kissed him.
11111111111111111111111111111.title: Back Home

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Madison and I were leaning against over the back of the couch; watching Aaron and Becky kissing at the door. Both of us started giggling; which was enough to stop them from kissing. Looking at us, Becky said, “Sorry girls, I forgot you were here.”

Closing the door, Aaron walked over to Becky and said, “What was with that kiss, Becky?”

“I haven’t seen you in over a week.” Incredulous, Becky said, “Can’t I give my boyfriend a kiss?”

That was enough to cause Madison and me to start giggling again; until Aaron gave us an angry look. We quickly went quiet as he turned to Becky. “Boyfriend?”

“Did you hit your head or something while I was gone?” confused, Becky said, “Aaron, we’ve been dating for almost 5 months.”

I wanted to see how Aaron was going to get out of this. Thinking for a moment, he said, “Sorry, it’s just a lot has happened over the last few days.”

“I suppose I can forgive you.” Turning her attention to Madison and me, Becky said, “Besides, I’d love a chance to spend some time with these two munchkins.”

Madison quickly jumped off the couch and ran over to hug Becky. While still confused as to what was going on, I followed her example and ran over to hug her as well. Looking at her, we both said, “Hi Becky.”

“Hi girls.” Kneeling down to hug us, she said, “I missed you guys.”
111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Surprise

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I hadn’t expected to have as much fun with Becky as I’d ended up having. I did feel bad for Aaron though because most of the fun was at his expense; the part being when we painted his fingernails.

After a while, Becky and Madison left the room to get something to drink. Once Becky was out of sight, Aaron turned to me with an angry look in his eyes. I started to get scared again; like I had when he yelled at us in the alley. Looking at me, he said, “What did I ever do to you?”

“What do you mean?”

“What did I ever do to you to deserve getting my nails painted?”

“For starters, you teased me about the pull-ups and the booster seat.” Looking at him, trying my best to look serious, I said, “Besides, I was just doing what Madison did. You should be angry with her.”

“Believe me, I’m plenty angry with her.” Sighing, Aaron said, “Because of that stupid wish of hers, you’re a 5-year-old girl instead of my best friend.”

“If you want to fix that, then find another stone!” pausing, I said, “It’s not like I can do it; what kind of 5-year-old kid knows how to use the internet.”

“Fine, I’ll do all the work to try and fix this.” Hearing footsteps, Aaron said, “In the meantime, try not to humiliate me in front of Becky.”

That gave me an idea. As Becky came back into the room, I ran up to her said, “Aaron wants us to give him a makeover!”

“Really?” glancing at Aaron, Becky said, “If that’s what he wants, I guess we can do it.”

Aaron was about to protest but was stopped when the front door opened. My parents and his parents came into the house.
Seeing Becky, my mom said, “Hello Becky, I didn’t expect to see you here.”

“Sorry, Mrs. Richardson.” Smiling, Becky said, “I heard Aaron was babysitting the girls, and you know how much I love spending time with them.”

Turning to Aaron, spotting the nail polish, Mr. Sullivan said, “I see the girls had some fun.”
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: Fun With Becky

11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Come with me, Aaron," Mommy said. "I've got some nail polish remover."

As Mommy led Aaron away, Daddy came to me. "Did you have fun while we were gone, princess?"

"Lots," I replied. "What did you do, Daddy?"

"Oh, we did some mommy-and-daddy stuff."

After a few minutes, Mommy and Aaron came back. "We'll see you tomorrow, then," Mr. Sullivan said, then the four of them left.

"What's tomorrow?" I asked.

"We're going to have lunch together," Mommy said. "All of us." She knelt down to my height. "Would you like to help Mommy?"

"Yes!"

"Well, how about you come to the station tomorrow morning, after breakfast?"

"Okay. What do we do?"

"You're going to help me tell them about the baby. It isn't often that you know something grown-ups don't know, is it?"

More often than you know, Mommy, I thought, but didn't say. Instead, I said, "No!"

"Okay. You just have to keep the baby a secret until I give the signal. Think you can do that?"

"Yes, Mommy." I was thrilled. I was going to help Mommy.

It wasn't until I was back in my room that I realized what was happening. I was thinking like a little girl again. It's happening again, I thought. And it'll happen more and more often, until there's no difference.

This time, though, it didn't scare me as much.
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After having a quick breakfast the next morning, Mommy and I got into her car and drove the Station. When we got there, I was immediately overcome by half a dozen of my mommy’s coworkers running over to me. I stood helplessly in the doorway while they fussed over me.

I was on the verge of crying when Mommy thankfully came to my rescue. With me in her arms, Mommy walked down the hall to the studio. Before we made it very far, a woman about mommy’s age came over to us. “Hey Mel, what’s Lizzie doing here?”

“I need her help with a story, Grace.”

Turning her attention to me, Grace said, “How are you doing today, Lizzie?”

I was overcome with shyness as I looked at her; but I managed to say, “I’m good.”

***********************


I was standing just off-stage, with a large sign, watching Mommy as she was delivering a news report. When she was finished, she turned to the camera and said, “Before we go to commercial, I have an important announcement to make.”

One of the co-anchors, a somewhat older woman, said, “You’re not leaving us, are you, Melanie?”

“No Margaret, I’m not leaving.” With a smirk, she said, “At least not for a few more months.”

“Then I’m confused; what kind of announcement are you going to make?”

“You’ll find out soon enough. But,” gesturing to me, she said, “I’m going to need some help from a very special helper.”

With the signal given, I walked out on the set; feeling a little overwhelmed by the lights and cameras. Turning to me, a male anchor said, “Hello Lizzie, what’s that you have in your hands?”

With a smile on my face, I turned the sign around to show it to the cameras. Everyone in the studio let out shocked gasps when they read it:

Baby Richardson
Coming May 2020


Turning to the cameras, Mommy said, “That’s right folks; the Richardson family is getting bigger.” Smiling, she said, “My little girl is going to be a big sister, and she couldn’t be more excited about it.”

I knew Mommy was making that last part up; especially considering the tantrum I’d thrown when they told me. Once the cameras stopped rolling and the commercials started, everyone ran over to congratulate Mommy on the news. As I stood there watching her, I realized just how happy she’d become.
111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At the Station

1111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I stayed at the Station for the next few hours while Mommy worked. I passed the time by doing little jobs for everyone. We finally left around 10:45. As Mommy and I walked to the car, she looked at me and said, “Hey sweetie, what do you say we go to the mall.” Smiling, she said, “We can get you a cute little outfit for your first day of school.”

“Okay!”

****************************


Once we got to the mall, I made sure to stay close to Mommy; I didn’t want to get lost. We immediately headed towards Old Navy; where Mommy quickly picked out a dress that she thought looked nice. I had to admit that I thought it looked pretty.

After paying for the dress, and a few other items, Mommy and I left the store. We were headed for the food court when I spotted
Madison walking towards me with her Mom. “Mommy! It’s Madison!”

Walking over to them, Mommy said, “Hi Grace.”

“Hi, Melanie.” Looking at me, Mrs. Sullivan said, “Hello Lizzie.”

“Hi!”

“What brings you two to the mall?”

“I suspect the same reason you’re here; getting Madison an outfit for her first day of school.”

“Can you believe they’re starting kindergarten?” chuckling, Mommy said, “It feels like just yesterday they were in diapers.”

“They’re growing up fast, aren’t they.” Pausing, Mrs. Sullivan said, “I was actually going to call you later on. I’m thinking of signing
Madison up for ballet, do you think Lizzie would want to join her?”

“I don’t see why not.” Looking at me, Mommy said, “Sweetie, would you like to take ballet with Madison?”

I wanted to say no, but I found myself unable to do so. Damn this child’s mind! Looking at Mommy, I said, “Yes!!!”

“I guess it’s settled then.” Smiling, Mrs. Sullivan said, “I’ll text you the details later.”

Suddenly Madison took my hand and pulled me over to a nearby fountain. Looking at me, she said, “Are you okay?”

My mental regression started to dissipate a little. Looking at Madison, I said, “I think so. Why?”

“Because you just agreed to take ballet classes with me.” Pausing, Madison said, “I just wanted to make sure that was Lizzie and not Travis.”

“You heard that psychic lady; we’re the same person.” Sighing, I said, “I’m not happy about it, but I can’t back out now.”

Before Madison could respond, Mommy walked over with Mrs. Sullivan. Looking at us, Mommy said, “Girls, you can’t just run off like that.”

I began to wonder why Mommy was so concerned, until I remembered that I was now a little girl. I wasn't the big, strong boy that I had been before the wish. Looking at her, I said, "Sorry, mommy."
1111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Shopping Trip

11111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As Mommy and I made our way to the food court, I saw another familiar face walking nearby. It was a girl named Amber Simmons; I had a bit of a crush on her. I was tempted to run over to her, but two things stopped me from doing so – I didn’t want Mommy to yell at me again, and I knew Amber wouldn’t know who I was.

Once we got to the food court, Mommy led me to the Subway restaurant in the far corner. After ordering our food, we took a seat in the center of the room. As I ate my kid’s meal, feeling somewhat disappointed that I could no longer eat a foot long grinder, I looked at Mommy and said, “When can we buy my clothes for ballet, mommy?”

“Not quite yet, pumpkin; although I’m glad to see you’re so excited.” Looking at me, she said, “We have to get you registered first.”

“Oh.” Pausing, I said, “Will I be in the same class as Madison?”

“We’ll have to see; her class may already be full.”

Sitting at the table, eating my sandwich, I found my thinking wondering if spending time away from Aaron and Madison was speeding up the process of my two personalities merging. Because I certainly wouldn’t have been interested in ballet before this.
11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At the Food Court

111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
When we got home, there was someone else's car in the driveway. "Look who's here, sweetie," Mommy said.

I could see it was an older couple, but I had no idea who they were. Nevertheless, I found myself getting excited to see them. It'll be a relief when I don't have to guess how I feel anymore, I thought.

Getting out of the car, Mommy waved at them. "Hi, Ma, hi, Pa," she called. Getting me out of the booster seat, she asked, "Wanna give Gramma and Grampa a great big hug?"

That was all I needed to hear. As soon as my little feet were on the ground, I ran right over to the people I now knew to be my grandparents. Grampa looked like Daddy, so I knew which side of the family they were from. Gramma looked familiar, but I couldn't place it. Oh, well, they were my grandparents now. Having spent 15 years of my life estranged from one set of grandparents and having no knowledge of the other, I was perfectly happy to have these two. "Mommy's gonna have a baby," I told them.

"We heard," Gramma said, "but thank you for telling us." Turning to Mommy, she asked, "How are you holding up, Mel?"

"I'm doing okay, Ma," she said. I guess it was an endearment. "Lizzie sounds excited about the baby now, but you should have seen the fit she threw when we told her."

"Kids are like that," Grampa said. "Peter certainly wasn't thrilled when Megan first came along."

Just then, a car I did recognize pulled into the driveway, and out stepped Mrs. Wilcox from Child Services. I didn't know why she was here, but I did know how upset Mommy got whenever Mrs. Wilcox came by. I stood there, watching, not sure what to expect.

What I definitely didn't expect was what happened. Mommy called out, "Megan!" , then ran over and hugged her.

I was puzzled at first, but then I put it together: Mommy had said that her college roommate, and Daddy's sister, was Megan. So, in this world, they were the best of friends.

"How are things at work?" Mommy asked.

"Going alright," Aunt Megan replied. "I've got my substitute trained, so it's maternity leave for me." She patted her big belly.
111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Surprises at Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the 5 of us stood outside the house, talking, I could hear some thunder in the distance. I started to feel a little apprehensive like I’d been during the storm a few days ago. A particularly loud clap of thunder came through and brought everyone’s attention to the approaching storm. We all got inside just as the rain started coming down in buckets.

While Mommy led the others to the couch, I started going towards the play area. Suddenly I felt a hand on my shoulder. Turning around, I saw Auntie Megan standing there. Looking at me, she said, “Come sit with me, kiddo.”

“Okay!”

Auntie Megan picked me up and, with some difficulty, carried me over to the couch. As we sat down on the couch, she said, “How are you doing, kiddo?”

“I’m good!” giggling, I said, “I’m going to take ballet classes!”

“Really?” looking at me, Megan said, “That sounds like fun.”

“Uh-huh!” looking at Mommy, I said, “I told Auntie Megan about ballet!”

Looking at Mommy, Auntie Megan said, “When does she start?”

“I haven’t actually signed her up yet.” Sitting next to Megan on the couch, Mommy said, “We ran into Madison and her mom at the mall. Long story short, Madison’s doing ballet and wants to do it with Lizzie.”

“That sounds like fun!” smiling, looking at me, Megan said, “You know Auntie’s first serious girlfriend was a ballet instructor.”

“That’s right, I totally forgot about her.” Looking at Megan, Mommy said, “I have to admit, I never really liked her that much.”

“Oh please, you never liked any of my girlfriends.” Looking at Mommy, with a smirk, Megan said, “Why do you suppose that is?”

Clearly getting uncomfortable, Mommy said, “I’m sure I have no idea what you’re talking about.”

“Oh please.” Smirking, Megan said, “What about all the times we took some Maui Wowie and had some fun?”

“Oh come on, I was only experimenting.”

“Uh-huh.” Pausing, Megan said, “You were on your way to a Nobel prize before you became interested in my brother.”

“Can we not talk about this right now?” gesturing to me, Mommy said, “I don’t think this is appropriate around my 5-year-old daughter.”

It was then that I had a momentary memory loss – forgetting what Maui Wowie was. Looking at Mommy, I said, “Mommy, what’s Maui Wowie?”

Before Mommy could stop her, Megan said, “It’s a college thing, sweetie.” Looking at me, she said, “You’ll find out about it when your roommate starts putting dryer sheets inside paper towel rolls.”

After glaring at Megan, Mommy looked at me and said, “Lizzie, sweetie, can you go upstairs and play?”

“Okay.” Jumping off the couch, I ran upstairs.

I stopped at the top of the stairs when I heard Mommy yelling at Megan. “Meg, I’d really appreciate if you didn’t talk about drugs in front of my 5-year-old daughter.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

11111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Upstairs, I put my favorite stuffed animals in chairs, and "we" had a tea party. "I'm so delighted you all could come," I said. "What with the rain, and the scary thunder."

"Oh, heavens," said Mrs. Snifflepuss, the elephant, "you know we wouldn't miss one of your parties for anything."

"That's right," said Mrs. Whiskertail, the rabbit. "Remember when the Queen apologized for scheduling a royal wedding on the same day as your masked ball?"

I shook my head. "My memory has been giving me problems lately. I used to know what Maui Wowie was, but today I had to ask Mommy. She got nervous and wouldn't tell me, and then I heard her say to Aunt Megan that it was drugs."

"If you ask me," said Mrs. Honeysnout, the teddy bear, "what's really puzzling you is what else your Aunt Megan said."

I thought back. "What was that about 'speriments? I didn't know Mommy and Aunt Megan were scientists."

"It's not that kind of experimenting," Mrs. Honeysnout said. "Mommy and Aunt Megan used to make each other happy. Now, looking back on that makes Mommy uncomfortable. She's scared of what it means about her."

"I guess that makes sense, " I said.

"Of course it does. You didn't think you were actually sitting here and talking to a bear, a rabbit, and an elephant, did you?"
11111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Playtime

111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was sitting in the corner of my room, playing with my dollhouse, when I heard a knock at the door. Getting up, I opened the door and saw Auntie Megan standing there. Looking at me, she said, “Hey kiddo, you mind if I come in?”

“Okay.” Looking up at her, I said, “Do you want to play with my dolls?”

“I’m afraid I can’t, kiddo.” Walking into the room, Megan said, “I think you and I should talk.”

I stood in the doorway for a few seconds, watching as Auntie Megan sat down on my bed. I remember a few instances, back before the wish, where she’d say the same thing to me. Only back then she wasn’t my aunt, she was just some woman from Social Services. She’d pull me aside and ask me, with my mom not in the room, if I was doing okay. This time, I knew it was going to be different.

Walking over to the bed, I hopped up and sat next to her. Looking at her, I said, “What do you want to talk about?”

“Well, for starters, I wanted to see how you were feeling about being a big sister.” Ruffling my hair, she said, “I understand you didn’t respond very well when you first found out.”

“I’m fine now, but I was upset when Mommy and Daddy told me about the baby.” Pausing, placing my hands on my lap, I said,
“I’m just worried they won’t pay attention to me after the baby is born.”

“You have nothing to worry about there, kiddo; your folks will always have time for you.” With a smirk, Megan said, “If they don’t, then Auntie Amber and I will make up for it.”

It didn’t take long to realize Amber was the name of Megan’s wife and my aunt. Looking at Megan, I said, “Are you excited about your baby?”

“Very much so.” With a grin, Megan said, “Between you and me, I’m looking forward to not having to go to the bathroom every 20 minutes.”

“Will I be able to see the baby?”

“Of course you will!” smiling, Megan said, “You’re going to be his cousin; of course you’ll get to see him.”

“Boys are icky.”

“Tell me about it.” Looking at me, Megan said, “I can’t believe your mommy left me for one; they are icky.”

I knew, deep down, what Megan was referring to; although it was a surprise to hear it – she and my mommy had been a couple in college. “Were you and mommy close? Like Madison and me?”

“Not quite like Madison and you, but close.” Taking a breath, Megan said, “You see, your mommy and I used to make each other very happy; until I messed things up and she left me for your dad.”

“Do you miss Mommy?”

Smiling, Megan said, “I did miss her; until I met Amber.”

After that, the two of us played for a few minutes until Megan had to leave. Following her downstairs, I said goodbye to her and my grandparents.
111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Aunt Megan Visits

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After Mommy put me to bed, I realized I was thirsty. I knew I couldn't reach the water faucet in the bathroom, which left me only one option: the kitchen downstairs. I thought I might get into trouble if Mommy and Daddy caught me, so I tried to be quiet.

Walking as quietly as I could, I made my way to the refrigerator. Opening the door just a crack, I took out a juice box. I took a sip, and felt better already.

I could hear Mommy and Daddy talking in another room, and wondered what they were talking about. I decided to get closer and see.

"What's wrong?" Daddy asked. "You've been on edge all night. Did something happen with my folks?"

"No," Mommy said.

"Megan?"

"Kind of. She brought up our time in college."

"Brought back memories, huh?"

"It got me thinking. I was so scared and angry when she told your folks we were together."

"And you ran to me in tears." Daddy was quiet for a while. "Do you regret it?"

"Maybe a little. Don't get me wrong, I love you, I love our daughter, and I love this one." Now it was Mommy's turn to be quiet. "I guess it's got me to thinking about all the things that might have been. I even asked myself what it would have been like if I'd said yes to Ed Malloy, back in high school."
